title: Ticket #4630: Updates to partitionable slot documentation
description:
In /doc/admin-man/multi-core.tex around line 665 it says:

"To enable dynamic provisioning, define a slot type with machine resources."

It is not necessary to assign it any resources; if you don't you'll get the "normal" definition (ie. "mem=auto, cpu=auto, swap=auto, disk=auto"). What is necessarily is to allocate at least one slot of that type using NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_<N>.

The bare minimum to set up partionable slots is: 

NUM_SLOTS=1
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1=1
SLOT_TYPE_1_PARTITIONABLE=TRUE

This creates a single partitionable slot that has all of the resources of the machine.
